author: michaelamadi
content:
Quick question about 7069

When does it return status code 2? Only when the upper 12 bits of the address is non-zero?

author: _shemnon
content: When the contract being called does a REVERT or INVALID or runs out of gas.

author: _shemnon
content: ASE violations cause the current frame to halt with an exceptional halt, like OOG.  So to the calling frame it looks like a 2.

author: _shemnon
content: Basically 1 corresponds to an error in the operation setting up the call (gas issues, not enough value, call stack too deep, etc), whereas 2 means the call was set up fine it's the contract that was called that had deliberate or accidental failures.

author: michaelamadi
content: Wait, isn't 2 returned when setting up the call failed? I'm looking at the EIP here https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7069
